title: Sovereignty of the People
summary: All power belongs to the people of Kenya. They can exercise it directly or through elected representatives.

title: Supremacy of the Constitution
summary: The Constitution is the highest law. Any other law that contradicts it is invalid.

title: Defense of the Constitution
summary: Every Kenyan has a duty to respect, uphold, and defend the Constitution.

title: The Republic
summary: Kenya is a sovereign republic founded on democratic principles and participation of the people.

title: Territory of Kenya
summary: Kenya’s territory includes its land, airspace, territorial sea, and the sea bed.

title: Devolution and Access to Services
summary: Kenya is divided into counties for effective governance and access to services.

title: National Language
summary: The national language is Kiswahili. English and Kiswahili are official languages.

title: Religion and State
summary: There shall be no state religion. Kenya respects freedom of religion.

title: National Symbols
summary: Kenya’s national symbols include the flag, anthem, seal, and coat of arms.

title: National Values and Principles
summary: National values include patriotism, human dignity, social justice, and the rule of law.
